metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4419 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The compare_tor_addr_to_addr_policy function in or/policies.c in Tor before 0.2.2.39, and 0.2.3.x before 0.2.3.21-rc, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit) via a zero-valued port field that is not properly handled during policy comparison.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4419` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tor - 0.2.3.22-rc-1
tor-geoipdb - 0.2.3.22-rc-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> looks like triggerable asserts that cause a DoS

criterions.comment: tor package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.3.22-rc-1').
